result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M Schober-Lange was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy M Schober-Lange is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy M Schober-Lange was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate.

Defendant shall be employed no less that 20 hours per week if pursing GED.
Defendant shall be employed no less than 40 hours per week if not actively pursing GED.
Expungement granted under 973.015 after successful completion of probation without any violations.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy M Schober-Lange in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Jeremy M Schober-Lange.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 1 and state moves to dismiss Ct 2. State will recommend 1 year probation with the following conditions: counseling deemed appropriate by DOC, DNA, court costs, expungement, and to be employed full time or enrolled in school full time or a combination of both. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1. Ct 2 dismissed per agreement. State heard. Attorney Christian heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard on sentencing. Court heard and orders 1 year probation with the following conditions: to have such assessment, treatment, counseling, and programming deeming appropriate by DOC, to be employed no less than 20 hrs per week if pursing GED or to be employed no less than 40 hrs per week if not actively pursing GED, defendant to pay court costs by 8/26/2022, DNA, and expungement.

Defendant Jeremy M Schober-Lange in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Jeremy M Schober-Lange.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. As of April 25, 2022, restitution has not been paid per homeowner. State and defendant do not have an agreement without payment of restitution ($415.18). Status and trial week continued.
Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
for confidential victim impact statement- denied

Defendant Jeremy M Schober-Lange appeared in court, Attorney David L. Christian appeared in court for Jeremy M Schober-Lange, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Brian Monahan sworn and testifies. Exhibit #1 offered and received. Cross examined. No argument from defense. Court finds probale cause to bind over. Informaiton will be with same charges. Defendant waives formal reading and defendant stands mute. Court enters not guilty pleads on his behalf. Court sets status and trial weeks.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
